title: Default Theme
description: The NextUI theme object is where you define your application's color palette, fonts, font sizes, breakpoints, border radius, and more.
url: https://nextui.com/docs/theme/default-theme
---

# Default Theme

The NextUI `theme` object is where you define your application's [color palette](/docs/theme/default-theme#colors),
[fonts](/docs/theme/default-theme#fonts), [font sizes](/docs/theme/default-theme#font-sizes),
[breakpoints](/docs/theme/default-theme#breakpoints), [border radius values](/docs/theme/default-theme#border-radius), and more.

<CarbonAd />

### Colors

NextUI includes a default color palette out-of-the-box that is a great starting point if you donâ€™t have your own specific branding in mind.

You can access the colors through the `theme` object or usign `tokens` whitin the `css` prop or `styled` components,
see the [theme object](/docs/guide/getting-started) for more information.

```jsx
import { useTheme, Text } from '@nextui-org/react';

const MyComponent = () => {
  const { theme } = useTheme();

  return (
    <div>
      <p style={{ color: theme.colors.primary.value }}>
        Using color theme value
      </p>
      <Text css={{ color: '$primary' }}>Using tokens</Text>
    </div>
  );
};
```

### Typography

To manage Typography options you can use the following keys:

1. fonts (font families)
2. fontSizes
3. fontWeights
4. lineHeights

#### 1. Fonts

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  palette: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {
    sans: "-apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', 'Roboto', 'Oxygen', 'Ubuntu', 'Cantarell',
    'Fira Sans', 'Droid Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;",
    mono: "Menlo, Monaco, 'Lucida Console', 'Liberation Mono',
    'DejaVu Sans Mono', 'Bitstream Vera Sans Mono'"
  }
  ...
};
```

#### 2. Font sizes

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  palette: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {
        xs: "0.875rem",
        base:"1rem",
        sm: "1.25rem",
        md: "1.5rem",
        lg: "2.25rem",
        xl: "3rem",
    }
  ...
};
```

#### 3. Font weights

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  palette: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {...}, // font sizes object
  fontWeights: {
    thin: 200,
    light: 300,
    normal: 400,
    medium: 500,
    semibold: 600,
    bold: 700,
    extrabold: 800,
    black: 900
  }
  ...
};
```

#### 4. Line heights

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  palette: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {...}, // font sizes object
  fontWeights: {...}, // font weights object
  lineHeights: {
    xs: 1,
    sm: 1.25,
    md: 1.5,
    lg: 1.625,
    xl: 1.75
  }
  ...
};
```

<Spacer y={2} />

### Radius

NextUI provides a set of commons sizes for controlling the `border-radius` of an element.

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  palette: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {...}, // font sizes object
  fontWeights: {...}, // font weights object
  lineHeights: {...}, // line heights object
  radius: {
    xs: "2px",
    sm: "6px",
    md: "10px",
    lg: "14px", // default for almost every NextUI component
    xl: "28px"
  }
  ...
};
```

<Spacer y={2} />

### Border weights

NextUI includes by default a set of common border weights.

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  type: '...', // theme type
  palette: {...}, // color palette object
  fonts: {...}, // font families object
  fontSizes: {...}, // font sizes object
  fontWeights: {...}, // font weights object
  lineHeights: {...}, // line heights object
  radius: {...}, // border radius object
  borderWeights: {
    light: "1px",
    normal: "2px",
    bold: "3px",
  }
  ...
```

<Spacer y={2} />

### Spacing

NextUI has a set of most common spaces values which allows you to customize the
global spacing and sizing scale for your project. By default these spacing value
can be referenced by the `padding`, `margin`, and `top`, `left`, `right`, `bottom` styles.

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  // ... previous theme properties
  spacing: {
    0: "0rem",
    xs: "0.5rem",
    sm: "0.75rem",
    md: "1rem",
    lg: "1.25rem",
    xl: "2.25rem",
    px: "1px",
    0.5: "0.125rem",
    1: "0.25rem",
    1.5: "0.375rem",
    2: "0.5rem",
    2.5: "0.625rem",
    3: "0.75rem",
    3.5: "0.875rem",
    4: "1rem",
    5: "1.25rem",
    6: "1.5rem",
    7: "1.75rem",
    8: "2rem",
    9: "2.25rem",
    10: "2.5rem",
    11: "2.75rem",
    12: "3rem",
    14: "3.5rem",
    16: "4rem",
    20: "5rem",
    24: "6rem",
    28: "7rem",
    32: "8rem",
    36: "9rem",
    40: "10rem",
    44: "11rem",
    48: "12rem",
    52: "13rem",
    56: "14rem",
    60: "15rem",
    64: "16rem",
    72: "18rem",
    80: "20rem",
    96: "24rem"
  }
  ...
};
```

NetxUI's spacing scale has been inspired by [Tailwind CSS](https://tailwindcss.com/).
The values are proportional, so 1 spacing unit is equal to 0.25rem, which translates to 4px by default in common browsers.

> **TIP**: If you need a spacing of 40px, divide it by 4. That'll give you 10. Then use it in your component.

<Spacer y={2} />

| Name | Space    | Pixels | <Spacer x={10} />                          |
| ---- | -------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------ |
| 0    | 0px      | 0px    | <Progress squared value={0} max={100} />   |
| px   | 1px      | 1px    | <Progress squared value={1} max={384} />   |
| 0.5  | 0.125rem | 2px    | <Progress squared value={2} max={384} />   |
| 1    | 0.25rem  | 4px    | <Progress squared value={4} max={384} />   |
| 1.5  | 0.375rem | 6px    | <Progress squared value={6} max={384} />   |

| 3.5  | 0.875rem | 14px   | <Progress squared value={14} max={384} />  |
| 4    | 1rem     | 16px   | <Progress squared value={16} max={384} />  |
| 5    | 1.25rem  | 20px   | <Progress squared value={20} max={384} />  |
| 6    | 1.5rem   | 24px   | <Progress squared value={24} max={384} />  |
| 7    | 1.75rem  | 28px   | <Progress squared value={28} max={384} />  |
| 8    | 2rem     | 32px   | <Progress squared value={32} max={384} />  |
| 9    | 2.25rem  | 36px   | <Progress squared value={36} max={384} />  |
| 10   | 2.5rem   | 40px   | <Progress squared value={40} max={384} />  |
| 12   | 3rem     | 48px   | <Progress squared value={48} max={384} />  |

| 48   | 12rem    | 192px  | <Progress squared value={192} max={384} /> |
| 56   | 14rem    | 224px  | <Progress squared value={224} max={384} /> |
| 60   | 15rem    | 240px  | <Progress squared value={240} max={384} /> |
| 64   | 16rem    | 256px  | <Progress squared value={256} max={384} /> |
| 72   | 18rem    | 288px  | <Progress squared value={288} max={384} /> |
| 80   | 20rem    | 320px  | <Progress squared value={320} max={384} /> |
| 96   | 24rem    | 384px  | <Progress squared value={384} max={384} /> |

<Spacer y={2} />

### Breakpoints

NextUI exposes to you a predefined set of commonly used breakpoints which are used on components
like [Container](/docs/layout/container) and [Grid](/docs/layout/grid).

```js
export default {
  // default theme object
  // ... previous theme properties
  breakpoints: {
    xs: '576px',
    sm: '768px',
    md: '992px',
    lg: '1200px',
    xl: '1400px'
  }
  ...
};
```

<Spacer y={2} />

### Shadows

NextUI provides a curated set of predefined shadows for `light` and `dark` themes.

```js
// light theme
export const lightTheme = {
  // default theme object
  // ... previous theme properties
  shadows: {
      xs: '0 2px 10px -3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
      sm: '0 5px 20px -5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
      md: '0 8px 30px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.15)',
      lg: '0 30px 60px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.15)',
      xl: '0 40px 80px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25)'
  }
  ...
};
// dark theme
export const lightTheme = {
  // default theme object
  // ... previous theme properties
  shadows: {
    xs: '0 2px 10px -3px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.1)',
    sm: '0 5px 20px -5px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.1)',
    md: '0 8px 30px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.15)',
    lg: '0 30px 60px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.15)',
    xl: '0 40px 80px rgba(20, 20, 20, 0.25)'
  }
  ...
};
```

<Spacer y={2} />

### Typescript types

```ts
type ThemeTypes = 'light' | 'dark';
```

```ts
interface NextUICommonSizes {
  xs: string;
  sm: string;
  md: string;
  lg: string;
  xl: string;
}
```

```ts
interface NextUIThemesPalette {
  text: string;
  white: string;
  black: string;
  link: string;
  code: string;
  border: string;
  background: string;
  foreground: string;
  selection: string;
  primary: string;
  secondary: string;
  success: string;
  warning: string;
  error: string;
  gradient: string;
  accents_1: string;
  accents_2: string;
  accents_3: string;
  accents_4: string;
  accents_5: string;
  accents_6: string;
  accents_7: string;
  accents_8: string;
}
```

```ts
interface NextUIThemesFonts {
  sans: string;
  mono: string;
}
```

```ts
interface NextUIBorderWeights {
  light: string;
  normal: string;
  bold: string;
}
```

```ts
interface NextUIFontSizes {
  base: string;
  xs: string;
  sm: string;
  md: string;
  lg: string;
  xl: string;
}
```

```ts
interface NextUIFontWeights {
  thin: string;
  light: string;
  normal: string;
  medium: string;
  semibold: string;
  bold: string;
  extrabold: string;
  black: string;
}
```

```ts
interface NextUISpacing {
  xs: string;
  sm: string;
  md: string;
  lg: string;
  xl: string;
  '0': string;
  px: string;
  '0.5': string;
  '1': string;
  '1.5': string;
  '2': string;
  '2.5': string;
  '3': string;
  '3.5': string;
  '4': string;
  '5': string;
  '6': string;
  ... // see above for more spacing values (Spacing section)
}
```

```ts
interface NextUIThemes {
  type: ThemeTypes;
  fonts: NextUIThemesFonts;
  palette: NextUIThemesPalette;
  borderWeights: NextUIBorderWeights;
  lineHeights: NextUICommonSizes;
  fontSizes: NextUIFontSizes;
  fontWeights: NextUIFontWeights;
  radius: NextUICommonSizes;
  spacing: NextUISpacing;
  breakpoints: NextUICommonSizes;
  shadows: NextUICommonSizes;
}
```
